column4: some 32bit legacy apps exist like flash(which is in beta on 64bit yes), the 64bit applies to binary executable formats only so just copying over your home directory should work, provided that different package revisions can cause problems
thanks! I am a bit of a newb when it comes to ubuntu filesystem but when installing packages does it all go to ~/home? what about the root folder? is there anything there that I should copy?
depends, it may overwrite the old grub
any way I can avoid this?
